name: Teucrium marum
Relationship: Compare: TEUCRIUM SCORODONIA - Wood-sage (in tuberculosis with mucopurulent expectoration; dropsy; orchitis and TUBERCULOUS EPIDIDYMITIS; ESPECIALLY in young, thin individuals with tuberculosis of lungs, glands; bones and uro-genitals, 3X). CINA; IGNAT.; SANG.; SIL.

Extremities: Pain in toe-nails, as if they had grown into flesh
Tearing pains in arms and legs
Affection of finger-tips and joints of toes
Eyes: Smarting in canthi; lids red and puffy; tarsal tumor
Respiratory: Dry cough, tickling in trachea; mouldy taste in throat when hawking up mucus, expectoration profuse
Stomach: Vomiting of large quantities of dark-green masses
Constant hiccough, attended with pain in back
Head: Excited, tremulous feeling
Strengthens brain after delirium tremens
Frontal pain; worse, stooping
Sleep: Restless, with twitching, choking, and starting up frightened
Nose: Chronic catarrh; discharge of large, irregular clinkers
Catarrhal condition of both anterior and posterior nostrils
Crawling in nostrils, with lachrymation and sneezing
Skin: Itching causes tossing about all night
Rectum: Crawling in the rectum after stool
Itching of anus, and constant irritation in the evening in bed

details: Nasal and rectal symptoms marked. POLYPI. Affections of children. Suitable after too much medicine has been taken. Over-sensitiveness. DESIRE TO STRETCH. A remedy of first importance in chronic nasal catarrh with atrophy; large, offensive crusts and clinkers. OZAENA. LOSS OF SENSE OF SMELL.
dosage: First to sixth potency. Locally for polypi, dry powder.
